alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Erie; Huron; Lorain; Medina; Richland; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 10:57PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Richland, central Huron, Erie, western Medina, northern Ashland, northwestern Wayne and southern Lorain Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1057 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Wakeman to 7 miles south of Norwalk to 6 miles west of Willard. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mansfield, Medina, Ashland, Shelby, Grafton, Willard, Wellington, Lodi, New London, Plymouth, West Salem, Wakeman, Savannah, Polk, Oberlin, Sullivan, Lagrange, Penfield, South Amherst and Pittsfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for north central, northeastern and northwestern Ohio.
